page.title: 04EDUCATION (CONTINUED)
page.content: Glamis Primary School has four classrooms, two in the original school building built in the mid 1800's, and two in "temporary" classrooms. There is a tarmaced playground, with shelters and a "soup kitchen gifted by Lord and Lady Strathmore on January 27th 1899 for the benefit of the children". This quotation comes from the School Log which is continuous from 1874 to 1978. The school has modern indoor toilets - a recent innovation, dating from early 1982. There are sports grounds in a nearby field in Glamis Castle grounds. Most children from Glamis goto Seconary School in Kirriemuir 8 km away. Children with learning difficulties goto school in Dundee 20 km away.
